Class DistributionConfig

java.lang.Object
eduni.project_distributionconfiguration.DistributionConfig
public class DistributionConfig extends Object
Represents the configuration of a probability distribution used in the simulation.

Each DistributionConfig defines a specific statistical distribution (e.g., Normal, Exponential, or Gamma) with its parameters. These configurations are used to generate random samples for service times or interarrival times in the simulation.

The buildGenerator() method creates a concrete ContinuousGenerator instance from the eduni.distributions library based on this configuration.

Example usage (for demonstration only): In this project, DistributionConfig objects are typically created based on user inputs from the GUI, which are then passed to MyEngine. 


 //Example of manual creation
 DistributionConfig config = new DistributionConfig("Normal", 10.0, 2.0, false);
 ContinuousGenerator generator = config.buildGenerator();
 double sample = generator.sample();

  • Constructor Details

    • DistributionConfig

      public DistributionConfig(String type, double param1, boolean forArrival)
      Constructs a single-parameter distribution configuration (e.g., Exponential).
      Parameters:
      type - the name of the distribution (e.g., "Negexp")
      param1 - the first parameter (mean, shape, or rate)
      forArrival - whether this distribution is used for arrival processes

    • DistributionConfig

      public DistributionConfig(String type, double param1, double param2, boolean forArrival)
      Constructs a two-parameter distribution configuration (e.g., Normal, Gamma).
      Parameters:
      type - the name of the distribution (e.g., "Normal" or "Gamma")
      param1 - the first parameter (mean or shape)
      param2 - the second parameter (standard deviation or scale)
      forArrival - whether this distribution is used for arrival processes

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public String getType()
      Returns the distribution type.
      Returns:
      the name of the distribution (e.g., "Normal", "Negexp", "Gamma")

    • getParam1

      public double getParam1()
      Returns the first distribution parameter.
      Returns:
      the first parameter value (e.g., mean or shape)

    • getParam2

      public double getParam2()
      Returns the second distribution parameter, if applicable.
      Returns:
      the second parameter value, or null if not used

    • buildGenerator

      public ContinuousGenerator buildGenerator()
      Builds and returns a ContinuousGenerator instance based on the distribution type.

      Supported types:

      • "Normal" – requires mean and standard deviation
      • "Negexp" – requires mean
      • "Gamma" – requires shape and scale
      Returns:
      a new ContinuousGenerator configured according to this distribution
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if parameters are invalid or distribution type is unknown

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this distribution configuration.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a human-readable summary of the distribution parameters
